results.name: Expansion of sqrt(2) in base 2.
comment: Bailey, Borwein, Crandall, & Pomerance prove a general result that the first n terms contain >> sqrt(x) 1's. Vandehey improves this to sqrt(2*n)(1 + o(1)). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 07 2017

formula: a(n) = 1/2 - (2*arctan(cot(2^(-(3/2)+n)*Pi)))/Pi + arctan(cot(2^(-(1/2)+n)*Pi))/Pi for n > 0 and n in Z. See link for a proof. - _Mariusz Iwaniuk_, Apr 20 2017
a(n) = floor(2^(-(1/2) + n)) - 2*floor(2^(-(3/2) + n)) for n > 0 and n in Z. See link for a proof. - _Mariusz Iwaniuk_, Apr 26 2017
program: w x r = bit : w (4 * (x - (4 * r + bit) * bit)) (2 * r + bit)
where bit = head (dropWhile (\b -> (4 * r + b) * b < x) [0..]) - 1
xref: Cf. A002193 (decimal version), A233836 (run lengths of 0's and 1's).
